did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: The William H. Pierce papers contains a single letter and transcription. The letter was written in 1862 and describes Pierce’s experience as a Confederate soldier in a training camp near San Antonio.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: William H. Pierce enlisted in the 8th Texas Cavalry Battalion (Taylor's Battalion, Mounted Rifles) early in the American Civil War. In May 1863, the 8th Texas Cavalry Battalion consolidated with other units to form the 1st Texas Cavalry. Primarily defending the Texas border, it mustered out in 1864.The fate of William H. Pierce is unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The William H. Pierce papers contain a single original letter and transcription, describing Pierce’s experience as a Confederate soldier in a training camp near San Antonio.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The William H. Pierce papers were arranged in a single folder prior to current processing.
Currently, the collection is arranged in one series: I. Correspondence.
